page.title: 09 CHILDREN'S GAMES - CALNE
page.content: There are different kinds of marbles. When I lived in Chippenham they called a "gosher" a "gobber", and they called a "king kong" a "German gobber". When we play marbles the aim is to roll your marble to hit your opponents marble. If you hit it you win their marble.Only two people play.You should play on a flat surface, the school playground is best. I play on the lawn at home. It is not a good idea to play by a drain.There are different rules in Calne from Chippenham. There is a rule here called "levelsies" which means if the marble is in a position round a corner and the opponent cannot hit it he can win the marble by taking his marble level with the other and then rolling it.Another rule which many people think is not fair is called "Nearly levels". You can level your marble close to the opponents.
